info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 17 at 10:06AM CDT until August 23 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota...
Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County.
Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County.
Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm.
* WHEN...From Monday evening to Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters begin to impact Cottonwood Street west of the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM CDT Sunday, the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 15.9 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.9 feet on 03/30/1962.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO SATURDAY MORNING
